trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class is a directory control that enables the application to search the directory for objects that have changed since a previous state.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.#ctor(System.Byte[])"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class using the specified parameter.
An opaque structure used by the server.
It is updated by the directory during each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class using the specified parameters.
An opaque structure used by the server.
It is updated by the directory during each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.
Specifies the behavior of the search.
This parameter can be zero or a combination of one or more of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions,System.Int32)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class using the specified parameters.
An opaque structure used by the server.
It is updated by the directory during each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.
Specifies the behavior of the search.
This parameter can be zero or a combination of one or more of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions"></xref>.
The maximum number of attributes to return.
The default is 1048576.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.AttributeCount"></xref> property specifies the maximum number of attributes to return.
The default value of this property is 1048576.
The maximum number of attributes to return.
There was an attempt to set a value less than zero.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.Cookie"></xref> property contains an opaque structure used by the server.
This property is updated by the directory during each <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.
An opaque structure used by the server.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.GetValue"></xref> method returns the data associated with this control.
The data associated with this control.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl.Option"></xref> property specifies the behavior of the search.
This property can be zero or a combination of one or more of the values of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions>.
The behavior of the search.
